sentence.Network_en: He looked at her hungrily. What eyes! What skin!
sentence.Network_cn: 他饥渴地看着她。瞧这眼睛！瞧这皮肤！

sentence.Network_en: I chomped hungrily through the large steak.
sentence.Network_cn: 我狼吞虎咽地吃着那一大块牛排。

PerfectNetExp.abs: humour n. 幽默；幽默感hungrily adv. 饥饿地；hungry adj. 饥饿的.
She reached up her arms and hungrily embraced her tall son ., 她伸出手忘情地拥抱她高大的儿子.
I had seen him wandering hungrily about the beach that morning ., 那天早上我看到过他如饥似渴地在海滩上徘徊.

entry.tran: 饥饿的;感到饿的;辘辘饥肠的
entry.def: When you are hungry, you want some food because you have not eaten for some time and have an uncomfortable or painful feeling in your stomach.

example.ex: My friend was hungry, so we drove to a shopping mall to get some food...
example.tran: 我的朋友饿了，于是我们开车去一家购物中心吃饭。

example.ex: She is reduced to stealing to feed her hungry family.
example.tran: 她沦落到要靠偷窃来养活饥饿的家人。

entry.def: If people go hungry, they do not have enough food to eat.

example.ex: Leonidas' family had been poor, he went hungry for years.
example.tran: 利奥尼达斯家曾经很穷，他有很多年都吃不饱肚子。

entry.def: If you say that someone is hungry for something, you are emphasizing that they want it very much.

example.ex: Susan was certainly hungry for a life different from the one she had made for herself...
example.tran: 苏珊无疑一心想过一种和现在不同的生活。

example.ex: I left Oxford in 1961 hungry to be a critic.
example.tran: 我于1961年离开牛津，渴望成为一名评论家。

means.word_mean: 1. in the manner of someone who is very hungry;

auth_sentence.content: The baby beside her...had grizzled hungrily.

sentences.en: As soon as the food arrived he dug in hungrily.
sentences.cn: 食物一端来他便狼吞虎咽地吃起来。

sentences.en: They dug into the pizza hungrily.
The boy snatched a piece of cake and ate it hungrily.
sentences.cn: 男孩抢过一块饼便贪婪地吃起来。
